results.title: The Best bits of the Late Show : Vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Joe Murray, Mark Gibson, Michael Hirsch, ABC-TV (Australia) and D Generation
results.brief_description: Here is your chance to re-live even more ‘classic’ moments from the D-Generation’s “The Late Show’ including; Shitscared, Graham and the Colonel, Understanding Wogs, Santo the Magnificent, Mick Molloy vs Eddie Charlton, ‘What’s that all about?’, plus literally dozens of sketches you’ll love to revisit.

results.title: The Bessemer converter
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare, Film Producers Guild and Merton Park
results.brief_description: This film describes the structure and operation of the Bessemer Convertor for making steel. Shows the raw materials, explains the chemical reactions which occur in the convertor, and points out the difference between basic and acid convertors.

results.title: The Bespoke overcoat
results.brief_description: Fender has worked as a clerk for many years in the cold warehouse of Ranting & Co., and wants one of the warm sheepskin overcoats stacked around him. Ranting refuses, and Fender asks his friend Morry the tailor to make a coat for him. However, Fender is fired and dies of cold before the coat is finished. His troubled ghost returns to Morry, and persuades him to help him take what he feels is his due - a sheepskin coat from Ranting’s warehouse.

results.title: The Bergen International Festival
results.brief_description: Describes the international cultural festival held in Bergen, Norway each year. The festival, attended by people from all over the world, is dedicated to the memory of Edvard Grieg. Outdoor theatre, philharmonic orchestras, folk dancing displays, ballet, singing and painting are some of the attractions. Concerts are held in historic buildings all over the town. Birgit Nilsson sings and finally the Bergen Harmonia plays Grieg’s Concerto in A Minor.

results.title: The Berenstain bears: Easter surprise: comic valentine
results.brief_description: This tape includes 2 tales featuring the Berenstain bears. “The Berenstain bears Easter surprise”; It looks like this Easter is not going to be a joyous one. Boss Bunny who delivers the eggs has decided to quit. Fortunately Brother bear (who has heard that he will be receiving a special Easter present) steps in to save the day. “The Berenstain Bears comic valentine”; Brother bear is receiving some romantic distractions from the forthcoming Valentines Day hockey game against the Beartown Bullies. The more he tries to concentrate on the game the more he receives Valentines cards. Can he get to the bottom of this and win the game?

results.title: The Berenstain bears: Christmas tree: meet big paw: play ball
results.brief_description: This tape features three tales from the series written and created by Jan and Stan Berenstain. “The Berenstain Bears’ Christmas tree”; Papa bear, Brother bear and Sister bear are unhappy when they cannot pick out a Christmas tree. All is not lost however when a wonderful surprise awaits them at the tree house. Directed by Mordicai Gerstein. “The Berenstain bears meet big paw”; There is a Thanksgiving legend that if a bear becomes too greedy he will incur the wrath of the 90 foot high Big Paw. Despite this warning Brother and Sister bear set out looking for food in the Sinister Bog. Directed by Mordicai Gerstein and Al Kouzel. “The Berenstain Bears play ball”; It is the start of Spring and Papa bear is training young Brother bear to be a baseball star in the Little League. Directed by Al Kouzel.

results.title: The Benefits of insects
results.brief_description: There are many million times more bugs in the world than there are people, in fact one spoonful of dirt can be home to many hundreds of bugs! Students will learn the benefits of insects and their relatives to humans. This video explores the link in the food chain between insects and other small animals, the process of pollination, the stages of growth in bugs, how bugs benefit the soil, and provides examples of some of the more common bugs such as mites, ants and millipedes. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teachers guide included.

results.title: The Belstone Fox
results.brief_description: An inescapably moving animal adventure film starring Eric Porter as a huntsman who unwittingly pits the forces of nature against each other. Tag, an orphaned fox cub, is reared with a litter of hound puppies and through this kindly act comes tragedy for both humans and animals. Also stars Rachel Roberts, Dennis Waterman, Jeremy Kemp and Bill Travers.
